title: Identify the Type of Conic
text: A conic section can be a circle, ellipse, hyperbola, or parabola. The general equation for conic sections is typically in the form Ax² + Bxy + Cy² + Dx + Ey + F $$=$$ $$0$$. To identify the type, check the coefficients A, B, and C in this equation.

title: Understanding Conic Discriminants
text:
To determine the type of conic from its equation, consider the discriminant, B² - 4AC. This value helps identify the conic section type:
- If B² - 4AC < $$0$$, it's either an ellipse or circle.
- If B² - 4AC $$=$$ $$0$$, it's a parabola.
- If B² - 4AC > $$0$$, it's a hyperbola.

text: For the given equation 9x² + 4y² + $$72x$$ + $$36y$$ - $$500$$ $$=$$ $$0$$, find the values for A, B, and C and calculate the discriminant B² - 4AC. What do the values suggest about the type of conic?
